thread.title: Freeth takes over at Gold Medal in expanded dnata role
thread.title_full: Freeth takes over at Gold Medal in expanded dnata role

title: Freeth takes over at Gold Medal in expanded dnata role
text:
Save 
Andy Freeth has been named as the new managing director of both Travel 2 and Gold Medal as part of owner dnata’s shake-up of its UK leadership team. 
Freeth, who was previously solely in charge of Travel 2, will also take responsibility for associated brands Pure Luxury and Simply Luxury. 
An announcement is expected to be made about the senior management team under Freeth in the coming weeks. 
Andrew Botteril, European chief executive for dnata Travel, said: “Andy has excelled within the Stella Travel Group for over eight years, in that time he has transformed Travel 2, driving the business forward to achieve growth in revenue and profitably consistently year after year. 
“I can think of no one better to realise the potential that sits within these two great businesses and I look forward to supporting him and his team as he works to pull the two businesses together.” 
Freeth added: “It is a real privilege to lead these two iconic trade facing brands, and the great people within them to the next phase of development. 
“We’ve made no bones about the fantastic opportunity there is to grow and develop our breadth and reach for dnata and I am truly excited about continuing to work with our partners and suppliers to achieve this.” 
Botterill has also confirmed some other names on his executive team. 
Bruce Wildgust is director of information technology; Simon Woodford is director of air product and Andy Stark will remain as managing director of The Global Travel Group.
